meanings.definition: A person who wastes time or resources on unnecessary or unproductive activities.
meanings.sent1: The boondoggler spent hours rearranging his desk instead of working.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a boondoggler and focus on completing your tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The boondoggler decided to alphabetize his pencil collection instead of finishing his report.
meanings.sent4: She was a boondoggler, always finding ways to avoid doing actual work.
meanings.sent5: The office boondoggler was known for organizing his paperclips by color rather than meeting deadlines.

meanings.definition: To engage in unnecessary or unproductive activities.
meanings.sent1: He tends to boondoggle by chatting with coworkers instead of working.
meanings.sent2: Try not to boondoggle too much and stay focused on your assignments.
meanings.sent3: She would often boondoggle by rearranging her desk multiple times a day.
meanings.sent4: The students boondoggled during class by passing notes instead of paying attention.
meanings.sent5: When feeling overwhelmed, he would boondoggle by organizing his bookshelf instead of studying.

meanings.definition: Something that is unnecessary or unproductive.
meanings.sent1: The extra meeting felt like a boondoggler, taking time away from actual work.
meanings.sent2: Avoid adding any boondoggler tasks to your to-do list.
meanings.sent3: The fancy pen holder on his desk was just a boondoggler, not serving any real purpose.
meanings.sent4: Her extensive collection of stickers seemed like a boondoggler, cluttering her workspace.
meanings.sent5: The new software update was a boondoggler, causing more issues than it solved.
